intro: Verticordia cooloomia, commonly known as the Cooloomia featherflower, is a striking member of the family Scrophulariaceae native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting a variety of pollinators. The plant typically grows in heathland environments, often on well-drained sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens due to its unique appearance.
